abstract: The youth of Massachusetts are of primary concern to legislators and citizens. This briefing report features three essays by experts  Fern Johnson, Deborah Frank, and Donna Haig Friedman  who focus on three aspects of children in need: children in foster care who need adoption, children who are hungry, and children who are homeless. Each report has further and more detailed suggestions for helping these children in need; below is a summary of the problems we face.
title: 2013 Massachusetts Family Impact Seminar: Youth at Risk, Part 2
subject: law
